intro: Gossia yelana, commonly known as the Yelana gossia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
